content:
The Witcher 3 is an incredible game, and it's definitely worth going back to. Even though it's an older game, its storyline, gameplay, and graphics still hold up extremely well. The Witcher 3 has a dedicated fan base, and many consider it a modern classic.

Here are a few reasons why you might want to go back to The Witcher 3:

1. **Story completion**: You've already invested time in the game, and the story is one of its strongest aspects. Completing the game will give you a sense of accomplishment and closure.
2. **Improved experience**: If you started playing last year, you might have encountered some bugs or performance issues. The game has received numerous patches and updates since then, making it a more polished experience.
3. **New content**: Even if you've completed the main story, there are still plenty of side quests, contracts, and DLCs (like the excellent Hearts of Stone and Blood and Wine expansions) to explore.
4. **Enhanced visuals**: If you're playing on a newer console or a more powerful PC, you might notice improved visuals and performance, making the game look and feel even better.

That being said, if you're interested in playing newer games, I understand that too. The Witcher 3 is a significant time investment, and you might want to try something fresh.

Here's a compromise: You could try playing a few hours of The Witcher 3 to see if it still holds your interest. If you find yourself getting drawn back into the world and story, then it might be worth continuing. If not, you can always put it on hold and try one of the newer games on the list.

Remember, there's no right or wrong decision here. It's all about what you're in the mood for and what will keep you engaged and entertained.
